Reviews.Title: “Get a room at their other building at Calle de Luis Vélez de Guevara”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussieBec
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated, beautiful rooms, flat screen tvs and friendly staff. Could use a bar fridge but that may be coming with the renovations. Good location but not easily signposted. 2nd floor of building 2.

Reviews.Title: “Central located”
Reviews.Author: mbg-3
Reviews.Content: The hostel was great for what we needed clean rooms,and towels. What you don't know is the breakfast is down the street simple to get you started.the lift is very small two to three people max and the hotel is on the third floor. We where happy to stay there.we found the hostel on booking buddy. We took a taxi from the airport 26.euro

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ana_bad
Reviews.Content: Good location, parking, average room. OK if you are looking just for a place to crash at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hostal is good for the money”
Reviews.Author: MoyerTN
Reviews.Content: Good location to Santa Ana and metro. Be prepared to check in on the 2nd floor. Check in can be confusing. Staff was VERY helpful and we would go back. very basic. No phone, hairdryer, clocks, etc.. they do have towels

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate - but paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: tarynandcraig
Reviews.Content: Hostal Martin is spotlessly clean and perfectly adequate. The rooms are tiny (I don't think I've ever seen a smaller bathroom) but all come with TVs and free wifi. However, the biggest letdown is the paper thin walls. You can hear absolutely everything going on in the rooms next door and outside (the housekeeping staff are very noisy). This usually doesn't bother me, I'm a very heavy sleeper, but here it did. If you don't mind this, its good value for money in a great location very close to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Pay in advance or be screamed at for not letting them scam you”
Reviews.Author: gehlor
Reviews.Content: I booked for 3 nights with a possible extension of 5 nights. They took my credit card number as a guarantee and promised not to use it if I arrived. On arrival I paid for the first 3 nights upfront, in cash, at the rate they quoted me on the internet. They didn't have a single room available so they gave me a double for the same rate. On the morning of the 3rd day, I went to the office and told them I would stay the other 5 days. That was Thursday morning and I was leaving early on the Wednesday morning. I thought it funny that no-one had asked me to pay for the rest of my days; it was a cash upfront hostel. Sunday I went to the office to pay, I had a busy next few days. The person there told me that my room cost 15Euros a night more than I was quoted and more than I had paid for the 1st 3 nights. So I said that no-one had told me nor given me the opportunity to change to neither a single room nor another hostel and so I wasn't prepared to pay that amount. He was the owner and wanted to talk to his staff. The next night I went down to try to sort things out and I was told that “they had told me”, when i said, "sorry, but that's just not true", the woman in the office got up out of her chair and started screaming and yelling at me. I was scared, I'm not used to being abused, and she was in my face! Because of this I didn't back down, I just left. Luckily I was meeting some Madridians for dinner so they came back to the hotel and in Spanish, we agreed with the owner for me to pay 100E + taxes (IVA) if I left the next morning. This was fine with me. I owed only E100 + E8 for the telephone bill and it was a compromise because according to my first receipt and the internet, the tax was included in the price but this was less than the extra 15E (see receipt photos). To cut a long story short, the next morning I went to the office with cash in hand. The screamer wasn't there. I was told she was pregnant and her hormones were bad (I'm a 58 yr old woman lol). But another man was there and he refused to accept the deal. I made him call the owner and so the story goes on. This took more than ¾ hour. I left happy-ish but exhausted. The point is what would you do if you were on your way to the airport and they tried to charge you more? First you would argue, and then you'd give up and pay the higher rate because you'd rather do this than miss your plane. THIS IS THEIR SCAM and also the taxes! Also there are 2 charges on my credit card. One I think is the telephone bill, and the other for 10 Euro, I have no idea but I hava a good bank. I also had problems with the cleaning lady, but that’s another story (see photo). The location of this hostel however is perfect. They also own Hotel Cervalo and 3 others nearby. My advice if you go to this hostel, pay everything upfront so they can't do this to you.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this weird place - there are so many better Hostals in the area”
Reviews.Author: PetraQuilitz
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are amongst the cheapest in Madrid and the location is good, but... in this location there are actually 3 (or even 4) hostals, one on every floor, sharing reservations (without telling their clients?). They even seem to have contracts with other hostals in the street. Chances are you won't get the room you reserved at the Martin, but one in a hostal on another floor or somewhere else in the street (in a hostals, of which you haven't read the ratings). This can lead to the following situation: I arrived at the hostal, but no room, despite reservation. A flustered front desk guy phoned a guy from one of the partner hostals, then rushed down which forced me to scramble after him down the stairs with my (heavy) suitcase. After waiting at the entrance 10 minutes in vain, where the other guy was supposed to pick me up, the hostal martin guy ordered me back upstairs, because suddenly there was another room available in that building. A minor detail giving some insight into the strangeness of the place: Apparently the guy at the front desk is working a whole night shift every night in that room with the bright head lamps and a loud constant beep (reminded me of "Lost") every 5 seconds enough to drive anyone insane (The alarm system, apparently). A not so minor detail: Turned out the room was only free for one night (despite reservation), so I would have to switch rooms. What do you do at 12 at night, with a checkin procedure already lasting 40 minutes and a business date tomorrow at 8. You shut up and go along with the madness. "When you are in the room, call me if you want the air condition turned on". "What?, turn it on now", I said (It was one of those bathtub nights with 32 degrees). I regretted that reply 6 hours later in a freezing cold room, while searching for a nonexistent switch on the AC box. What could one possibly do to an AC that would prompt a hostal owner to remove any setting mechanism. Took 20 minutes under an admittedly well functioning shower to warm me up again. The thing about the TV (besides having no remote), is that it was so big, it blocked the entire surface of the only table in the room, so your suitcase has to go on the floor. And then there was this strange living room next to the entrance that looked like someone's grandmother had died in there, with a huge messy pile of dirty towels on the sideboard that staid there untouched 2 days. Creepy. Why ruin your belief in mankind by staying in a weird, disorganized place like this. Try some of the hundreds of other hostals in the area, all with great location, all with absolute basic prices, most of them with better service. May I recommend the hostal Cervantes or the Hostal Principado, just as two of many more examples. (This tip is not hearsay, I stayed in both of them)

Reviews.Title: “You may end up somewhere cheaper”
Reviews.Author: george2997
Reviews.Content: We booked through a booking agency several weeks in advance but when we arrived at Hostal Martin the receptionist appeared not to recognise our booking existed. After 20 minutes waiting in a side room he advised us that we had to go to another hostal nearby as his rooms were not available. We were collected and taken to this hostal. This hostal did not have the facilities we had paid for, eg air conditioning, internet, safe. Having seen other reviews it seems that this happens to other people as well. We still had to pay the full cost of the original booking. If you don't need the above facilites then the Hostal Nieto is nearby and cheaper and is very clean. If you do need the above facilities then booking with the Hostal Martin will not guarantee them.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hostal in an ideal position.”
Reviews.Author: Philippak
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we booked in and then we were walked to another building in a street off Atocha. The building was very quiet, and our room clean and adequate. It took us some time to work out the lift system! It wasn't till we went to check out that we discovered there was a kitchen and internet. The position of the hostal was ideal. We were in walking distance to the museums and lots of bars.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hostal to friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: pagam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were very comfortable. The room was very clean and large enough for the 3 of us ( triple room). The bathroom was tiled nicely and was clean - towels were changed every day and hot water was always available. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was quite a lot of noise in the night and early morning due to door slamming ( other guests I suppose) and the water heater pumping the water. We had a room overlooking a courtyard and someone kept slamming the entrance door which created a loud echo. Breakfast was not provided but there is a very nice bar just outside that serves breakfast combinations for a very low price. Across the road there was a tapas bar that served excellent food and was typically decorated. All in all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SebastianDallas
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults) stayed one night at the Hostal Martin/Cervelo (dfferent floors, same management). The place was incredibly convenient, walking distance from Plaza del Sol, Plaza Major, The Prado, and the Renfe-Atocha train station. Close to subway too. The room and bath were clean and quiet. Hotel staff was very helpful and most spoke English. Simple lounge area with computer station and wireless internet in the room. Definitely a good budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: explorermom_5
Reviews.Content: Going back to look at reviews again before writing this, I saw some that would have deterred me from staying at Hostal Martin (somehow I didn't see those before our trip). My initial impressions of Hostal Martin during booking were very good. They were extremely responsive on email and we had several communications before our departure. We chose the hostal as a quick overnight prior to our early morning departure from Madrid. It is well-located for trains, Metro and major museums. I highly recommend the restaurants on Plaza de Santa Ana (especially Lateral) around the corner from Hostal Martin. The hotel staff accommodated my request for a room with especially good air conditioning since it was very hot the day we arrived. The room was down a long maze of hallways, was very basic, but clean and served our purpose for the short time we were there. I just read another review about a safety issue in the lobby. I thought about that myself while coming and going, but we did not experience any problems. The staff also arranged for a very early airport shuttle, which was reliable and prompt. I would stay here again based on the service we received from the staff. I wouldn't stay more than one night, but it met our needs for a low cost option.

Reviews.Title: “dire”
Reviews.Author: seabach
Reviews.Content: probably the worst hostel I've been to during the last year. The room was dark, grimy and with gargling water pipes as background tracking. The 'ensuite' bathroom may sound grand until you've been there that is. There was an underlying odour that was impossible to shake off and is still in my nostrils writing this review so I think I'll just leave off here. Oh by the way we left right the next morning although we had booked a couple of nights and found a place round the corner at the same price but much better. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Doricanuck
Reviews.Content: Generally fair value for €57 for smallish, plain but very clean and recently refurbished double room. Great location - close to metro, many attractions, restaurants and a very good breakfast cafe about 5 doors down Calle Atocha. We were able to switch after one night from an extremely tiny double room in Hostal Cervelo (same operators, on 1st floor where reception is) to something a bit more spacious on the same floor (i.e. we never did stay in Hostal Martin itself), else our rating would have been 1-2 points lower. After reading other reviews, we took care to request a quieter room away from Atocha when we booked so noise wasn't an issue. Staff are friendly and helpful and the lift would be a plus for older travellers with heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “Was Mugged in the Lobby of the building.”
Reviews.Author: NYC-TravelEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: Be warned this property is not safe. I was mugged by 3 individuals entering the building 2 weeks ago. They do not have any security cameras out front or in the lobby. When the person on duty finally came down after I screamed he would not call the police or allow me to use a phone to call home. I was knocked unconcious by a choke hold and in addition to calling the police they should have called a doctor to see me. For all I know he was in on the assault. I was buzzing the doorbell for longer than I should have and the assailant came in behind me. For the lack of safety, security and human decency I do not recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jemarlin
Reviews.Content: Good service and fantastic location, you can get museums area in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; good location”
Reviews.Author: Griendling
Reviews.Content: Entrance was not very appealing, but the hostel itself was quite nice given the price. Rooms were very clean and quiet and the water pressure was great. The bakery next door, called Peter Pan, was outstanding. Hostel is about 1 block from nearest metro station. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was central for sightseeing. Free internet access through a PC located in the lobby. Very good value for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FisherTours
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Hostal Martin but ended up staying at one of their sister sites just up C/Atocha on Luis Velez. Stayed 4 nights. Very clean, comfortable, ensuite rooms, with balcony over the main street. TV, air con, great bathrooms: the rooms look like they've been recently renovated and were priced 46 euro per night, which is a great price for such a central location. The Luis Velez hostal is a 2 minute walk to Plaza Santa Ana (lots of cafes and tapas bars) and handy for the subway (again a bargain at 1 euro to travel from the airport into the city centre).

Reviews.Title: “Very budget!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amireh
Reviews.Content: I am not a princess, but I do expect cleanliness and a friendly staff. Finding the hostal building was easy, a few blocks from the metro but the office situation was a bit of a mess. The hostal shares an office with another hostal and the staff was not all that friendly, although they spoke English a little. I requested a quiet room and after wandering through a maze reached a smelly room with dirty towels. After requesting new towels, I realized that all their towels were gross. I got used to the smokey smell in the room but not to the bug that crawled across the floor. Also, they only take cash. Location was fine, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Maurice1
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this spotlessly clean hostal slap bang in the middle of Madrid, near all the main sights. For a simple but comfortable en suite single room it was very good value at about E40 per night (no breakfast, but who cares!). The building with it's old wooden staircase has a bit of character, there's free internet access in the reception area and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only fault I could give it was it was a bit noisey at times, but I still slept well every night.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: somerset94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hostal Martin for 3 nights, this is a budget hostal and we were not quite sure what to expect. It is centrally located, and is very clean with good size rooms. If you book make sure you ask for a room back inside of the building not on the road because it is a very busy road and the traffic noise makes it difficult to sleep. Good overall value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ICOS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after the hostel I previously reserved lost my reservation. Luckily, Hostal Martin had rooms available. I paid 40 euros/night for a single room with ensuite bathroom, which was a bit expensive for Spain, but it ended up being totally worth it. My room was very clean, the bathroom was sparkling as well. I had a tv and small desk too. The location couldn't have been better, within walking distance to most major sights. The view from my room was just the wall of another building, and on sat. night, I could here some loud music and other noises, but it wasn't loud enough to keep me up. The staff there was very kind and helpful, and the building was safe and secure. I would stay here again without a second thought.
